meanings.definition: A person who helps someone recover from illness or injury.
meanings.sent1: The kind rehabilitator assisted the injured bird in getting better.
meanings.sent2: The rehabilitator at the hospital guided the patient through physical therapy.
meanings.sent3: The rehabilitator joked that even the broken toy needed some TLC to heal.
meanings.sent4: She was a rehabilitator of broken hearts, always there to mend the pain.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated rehabilitator worked tirelessly to aid in the recovery process.

meanings.definition: A facility or program that helps individuals overcome addiction or other issues.
meanings.sent1: The local rehabilitator provided counseling services for those struggling with addiction.
meanings.sent2: The rehab center offered various programs to support the residents' journey to sobriety.
meanings.sent3: At the support group, the rehabilitator shared success stories to inspire others.
meanings.sent4: The rehab facility was a beacon of hope for those seeking a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The community praised the efforts of the rehabilitator in helping people turn their lives around.

meanings.definition: The act of restoring someone to health or normal life.
meanings.sent1: Her rehabilitator after the surgery was diligent in ensuring a smooth recovery.
meanings.sent2: The rehabilitator of the old building brought it back to its former glory.
meanings.sent3: The garden's rehabilitator, the gardener, worked hard to revive the dying plants.
meanings.sent4: The rehabilitator of the antique clock carefully repaired it to its working condition.
meanings.sent5: The rehabilitator of the neglected park transformed it into a vibrant community space.
